name: Titanium.App.iOS
summary: The top-level App iOS module, available only to iOS devices, that includes the facilities to create and manage local notifications and background services.

events.name: notification
events.summary: Fired when a local notification is received by the application.

properties.name: alertAction
properties.summary: Alert button text ('View', by default) or slider text ('slide to unlock...', by default).

properties.name: alertBody
properties.summary: Alert message.

properties.name: alertLaunchImage
properties.summary: Image displayed instead of `Default.png` when launching the application.

properties.name: badge
properties.summary: Application badge value.

properties.name: date
properties.summary: Date and time when the notification was configured to fire.

properties.name: sound
properties.summary: Name of the sound file configured to play when the notification was fired.

properties.name: timezone
properties.summary: Timezone of the date when the notification was configured to fire. Available in Titanium SDK 7.4.0+.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: Custom data object.

properties.name: inBackground
properties.summary:
Boolean indicating if notification was received while app was in background. Available in Titanium SDK 6.2.0.
On iOS 10+ this is no longer available since this event will only fire if the app is in foreground.

properties.name: threadIdentifier
properties.summary:
The unique identifier for the thread or conversation related to this notification request.
It will be used to visually group notifications together. Available in Titanium SDK 7.5.0+ and iOS 10+.

properties.name: category
properties.summary: The identifier of the app-defined [category object](Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory). Available in Titanium SDK 7.5.0+ and iOS 10+.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: localnotificationaction
events.summary: Fired when a user selects an action for an interactive local notification.

properties.name: alertAction
properties.summary: Alert button text ('Open', by default) or slider text ('slide to unlock...', by default).

properties.name: alertBody
properties.summary: Alert message.

properties.name: alertLaunchImage
properties.summary: Image displayed instead of `Default.png` when launching the application.

properties.name: badge
properties.summary: Application badge value.

properties.name: category
properties.summary: Identifier of the category of the interactive notification.

properties.name: date
properties.summary: Date and time when the notification was configured to fire.

properties.name: identifier
properties.summary: Identifier of the action that was selected of the interactive notification.

properties.name: sound
properties.summary: Path to the sound file configured to play when the notification was fired.

properties.name: timezone
properties.summary: Timezone of the date when the notification was configured to fire.

properties.name: typedText
properties.summary: User input if the notification used the `USER_NOTIFICATION_BEHAVIOR_TEXTINPUT` behavior.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: Custom data object.

properties.name: inBackground
properties.summary:
Boolean indicating if notification was received while app was in background (since Titanium SDK 6.2.0).
On iOS 10+ this is no longer available since the event will only fire when opening the app after interacting
with a notification from the iOS notification center (which means the app was in background when the
notification was received).

properties.name: threadIdentifier
properties.summary:
The unique identifier for the thread or conversation related to this notification request.
It will be used to visually group notifications together. Available in Titanium SDK 7.5.0+ and iOS 10+.

properties.name: category
properties.summary: The identifier of the app-defined [category object](Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory). Available in Titanium SDK 7.5.0+ and iOS 10+.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: remotenotificationaction
events.summary: Fired when a user selects an action for an interactive remote notification.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: The payload passed to the Apple Push Notification Service.

properties.name: category
properties.summary: Identifier of the category of the interactive notification.

properties.name: identifier
properties.summary: Identifier of the action that was selected of the interactive notification.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: backgroundfetch
events.summary: Fired when the application is woken up for a fetch operation. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description:
Add this event if your app supports the fetch UIBackground mode. When an opportunity arises to download data, the system fires this event to give your app a chance to download any data it needs. Your callback of this event should download the data, prepare that data for use, and call the endBackgroundHandler method with the handlerID parameter from this event.

When this event is fired, your app has up to 30 seconds of wall-clock time to perform the download operation and call the endBackgroundHandler method. In practice, your app should call the endBackgroundHandler method as soon as possible after initiating the download. If you do not call the endBackgroundHandler method in time, your app is suspended. More importantly, the system uses the elapsed time to calculate power usage and data costs for your app's background downloads. If your app takes a long time to call endBackgroundHandler method, it may be given fewer future opportunities to fetch data in the future.

If you are downloading large content, initiate the download using a urlSession background download task, then call the endBackgroundHandler method. Listen for the downloadcompleted event to prepare the data for use.

The event returns the dictionary containing the handlerID property, which is a unique handler ID for the current event. This identifier should be passed as the argument to the endBackgroundHandler method.

properties.name: handlerId
properties.summary:
Unique string identifier for the `backgroundfetch` event. This identifier should be passed as the argument
to the [endBackgroundHandler](Titanium.App.iOS.endBackgroundHandler) method.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: silentpush
events.summary: Fired when the application is woken up by a silent remote notification. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description:
Add this event if your app supports the remote-notification UIBackground mode. This event is intended as a means for apps to minimize the time that elapses between the user seeing a push notification and the app displaying the associated data. When a push notification arrives, the system displays the notification to the user and launches the app in the background (if needed) so that it can call this event. Use this event to download any data related to the push notification. When your method is done, call the endBackgroundHandler method with handlerID parameter from this event.

The system fires this event regardless of the state of your app. If your app is suspended or not running, the system wakes up or launches your app and puts it into the background running state before firing the event.

When this event is fired, your app has up to 30 seconds of wall-clock time to perform the download operation and call the endBackgroundHandler method. In practice, your app should call the endBackgroundHandler method as soon as possible after initiating the download. If you do not call the endBackgroundHandler method in time, your app is suspended. More importantly, the system uses the elapsed time to calculate power usage and data costs for your app's background downloads. If your app takes a long time to call endBackgroundHandler method, it may be given fewer future opportunities to fetch data in the future.

If you are downloading large content, initiate the download using a urlSession background download task, then call the endBackgroundHandler method. Listen for the downloadcompleted event to prepare the data for use.

The event returns the dictionary containing the handlerID property, which is a unique handler ID for the current event. This identifier should be passed as the argument to the endBackgroundHandler method.

You can send extra information with a silent push using extra:

{
  aps: {
    'content-available': 1
  },
  extra: {
    foo: 'bar'
  }
}

In the event handler for silentpush, your code may look something like this:

{
  "handlerId": "SilentPush-1415976886.375816",
  "aps": {
    "content-available": 1,
  },
  "extra": {
    "foo": "bar"
  },
  "bubbles": true,
  "type": "silentpush",
  "source": {},
  "cancelBubble": false
}

properties.name: handlerId
properties.summary:
Unique string identifier for the `silentpush` event. This identifier should be passed as the argument
to the [endBackgroundHandler](Titanium.App.iOS.endBackgroundHandler) method.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: backgroundtransfer
events.summary: Fired when the events related to a urlSession are waiting to be processed. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description:
The app fires this events when all background transfers associated with a urlSession object have finished or failed. Use this method to reconnect any urlSessions and to update your app's user interface. For example, you might use this method to update progress indicators or to incorporate new content into your views. After processing the events, call the endBackgroundHandler method with the handlerID parameter. If a urlSession finishes its work when your app is not running, the system launches your app in the background so that it can process the event. In that situation, use the provided identifier to create a new urlSessionConfiguration and urlSession objects. Upon creating urlSession object, that object calls the appropriate delegate methods to process the events.

If your app already has a session object with the specified identifier and is running or suspended, you do not need to create a new session object using this method. Suspended apps are moved into the background. As soon as the app is running again, the urlSession object with the identifier receives the events and processes them normally.

At launch time, the app does not call this method if there are uploads or downloads in progress. If you want to display the current progress of those transfers in your app's user interface, you must recreate the session object yourself. In that situation, cache the session identifier value persistently and use it to recreate your session object.

properties.name: handlerId
properties.summary:
Unique string identifier for the `backgroundtransfer` event. This identifier should be passed as the argument
to the [endBackgroundHandler](Titanium.App.iOS.endBackgroundHandler) method.

properties.name: sessionId
properties.summary:
The identifier of the URL session requiring attention. If your app was just launched,
you can use this identifier to create a new `urlSession` object that can receive the events.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: downloadprogress
events.summary: Fired periodically to inform the app about the download's progress of a urlSession. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description: This event only needs to be used if your app is using the urlSession module to download data.

properties.name: taskIdentifier
properties.summary: The `urlSession` download task's identifier.

properties.name: sessionIdentifier
properties.summary:
The `urlSession` session identifier. If it does not exist, this property is not provided.
This property is available since Titanium Mobile 5.4.0.GA.

properties.name: bytesWritten
properties.summary: The number of bytes transferred since the last time this event was fired.

properties.name: totalBytesWritten
properties.summary: The total number of bytes transferred so far.

properties.name: totalBytesExpectedToWrite
properties.summary:
The expected length of the file, as provided by the Content-Length header. If this
header was not provided, the value is zero.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: uploadprogress
events.summary: Fired periodically to inform the app about the upload's progress of a urlSession. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description: This event only needs to be used if your app is using the urlSession module to upload data.

properties.name: taskIdentifier
properties.summary: The `urlSession` upload task's identifier.

properties.name: sessionIdentifier
properties.summary:
The `urlSession` session identifier. If it does not exist, this property is not provided.
This property is available since Titanium Mobile 5.4.0.GA.

properties.name: bytesSent
properties.summary: The number of bytes transferred since the last time this event was fired.

properties.name: totalBytesSent
properties.summary: The total number of bytes transferred so far.

properties.name: totalBytesExpectedToSend
properties.summary:
The expected length of the file, as provided by the Content-Length header. If this
header was not provided, the value is zero.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: downloadcompleted
events.summary: Fired to indicate that a urlSession's download task has finished downloading. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description: This event only needs to be used if your app is using the urlSession module to download data.

properties.name: taskIdentifier
properties.summary: The `urlSession` download task's identifier.

properties.name: sessionIdentifier
properties.summary:
The `urlSession` session identifier. If it does not exist, this property is not provided.
This property is available since Titanium Mobile 5.4.0.GA.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: The downloaded data as a Titanium.Blob object.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: sessioncompleted
events.summary: Fired to indicate that a urlSession task finished transferring data. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description:
This event only needs to be used if your app is using the urlSession module to download data.

Server errors are not reported through the error parameter. The only error events sent through the error parameter are client-side errors, such as being unable to resolve the hostname or connect to the host.

properties.name: taskIdentifier
properties.summary: The `urlSession` download task's identifier.

properties.name: sessionIdentifier
properties.summary:
The `urlSession` session identifier. If it does not exist, this property is not provided.
This property is available since Titanium Mobile 5.4.0.GA.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the operation succeeded. Returns true if download succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.summary: The error code of the error, if any (potentially system-dependent).

properties.name: message
properties.summary: A string containing the localized description of the error.

properties.name: responseText
properties.summary: The response text for upload tasks (since SDK 7.2.0).

properties.name: statusCode
properties.summary: The response status code for upload tasks (since SDK 7.2.0).

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: sessioneventscompleted
events.summary: Fired to indicate that all messages enqueued for a urlSession have been delivered. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
events.description:
This event only needs to be used if your app is using the urlSession module to download data.

In iOS, when a background transfer completes and if your app is no longer running, your app is automatically relaunched in the background, and the app fires the backgroundtransfer event. This event should contain the identifier of the session that caused your app to be launched. Your app should then store that handlerID before creating a background session configuration object with the same identifier, and creating a url session object with that configuration. The newly created session is automatically reassociated with ongoing background activity.

When your app later receives a sessioneventscompleted event, this indicates that all messages previously enqueued for this session have been delivered, and that it is now safe to invoke endBackgroundHandler method with the handlerID or to begin any internal updates that may result in invoking this method.

properties.name: sessionIdentifier
properties.summary:
The `urlSession` session identifier. If it does not exist, this property is not provided.
This property is available since Titanium Mobile 5.4.0.GA.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.summary: Fired when the user notification settings are registered.

properties.name: types
properties.summary: Notification types the application is registered to use.

properties.name: categories

properties.name: bubbles

events.name: watchkitextensionrequest

deprecated.notes: Use Titanium.WatchSession instead, which is supported on iOS 9 and later.

events.summary: Fired when openParentApplication:reply is called from a WatchKit extension. Available only on iOS 8.2 and later.
events.description:
Add this event if your Titanium application if you are using a WatchKit extension. When your WatchKit extension uses the openParentApplication:reply method your Titanium application will be opened in the background and provides your Titanium app the information from the extension. When this event is fired you must provide a reply by calling the sendWatchExtensionReply method with the handlerID parameter from this event.

The event returns the dictionary containing the handlerID property, which is a unique handler ID for the current event and the userInfo property, containing the dictionary passed from the WatchKit extension. The handlerID identifier must be passed as the an argument to the sendWatchExtensionReply method.

Ti.App.iOS.addEventListener("watchkitextensionrequest",function(e){
    var replyContent = {foo:"bar"};
    Ti.App.iOS.sendWatchExtensionReply(e.handlerId,replyContent);
});

properties.name: handlerId
properties.summary:
Unique string identifier for the `watchkitextensionrequest` event. This identifier should be passed an argument
to the [sendWatchExtensionReply](Titanium.App.iOS.sendWatchExtensionReply) method.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The payload passed to the `openParentApplication:reply` method from the WatchKit extension.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: continueactivity
events.description:
Add this event if your Titanium application if you are responding to an iOS Handoff or Core Spotlight continueUserActivity request. This event will fire when a user taps on the handoff icon or the Core Spotlight search item. Your Titanium application will be opened in the background and provides your Titanium app the information from the NSUserActivity. When this event is fired you should implement logic within your application to allow the user to pick-up from where they left off on their other device.

Ti.App.iOS.addEventListener("continueactivity", function(e) {
    console.log('activityType: '' + e.activityType);
});

properties.name: activityType
properties.summary: Unique string identifier for the handoff user activity. The identifier must be defined in your `tiapp.xml` file.

properties.name: searchableItemActivityIdentifier
properties.summary: With field will contain the searchable Unique Identifier if the continueactivity is fired from a Core Spotlight searh result.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: The optional title provided to the user activity or search item.

properties.name: webpageURL
properties.summary: The optional webpageURL provided to the user activity.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary:
The optional userInfo provided to the user activity. The userInfo is a custom dictionary and can contain any information needed
to create your handoff or Core Spotlight session.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: subtitle

properties.name: userInfo

properties.name: bubbles

events.summary: Fired when a new URL is handled by the application.
events.description: Incoming URL's can either be triggered by an external application or links inside your Titanium.UI.WebView / <Modules.SafariDialog>.

properties.name: launchOptions
properties.summary: The launch options that are related to opening the URL.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: source

parameters.name: id
parameters.summary:
Application-created ID of the local notification to cancel.
To create an ID for the notification, set the `id` property in the `userInfo` dictionary
passed to the <Titanium.App.iOS.scheduleLocalNotification> method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.SearchableIndex> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.SearchableItem> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.SearchableItemAttributeSet> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.SearchQuery> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.UserActivity> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createUserDefaults
methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Titanium.App.iOS.UserDefaults.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.App.iOS.UserDefaults except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationAction> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by <Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory> except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: endBackgroundHandler
methods.summary: Marks the end of the app execution after initiating the download operation. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
methods.description: When calling this method, pass in the handlerID value that initiated the background state. You must call this handler after initiating the download operation and should do so as soon as possible.

parameters.name: handlerID
parameters.summary:
Unique string identifier for the event (`backgroundfetch`, `silentpush` or `backgroundtransfer`)
that initiated the background opertation mode.

methods.name: registerBackgroundService
methods.summary: Registers a service to run when the application is placed in the background.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary:
Parameters used to create the service. Must include a `url` property, to specify the
local JavaScript file to execute when the application is placed in the background.

methods.name: registerUserNotificationSettings
methods.summary: Registers the application to use the requested notification types and categories.
methods.description: Call this method at application start up. If the application needs to register for remote notifications, call this method before calling registerForPushNotifications.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Parameters used to enroll the application in local notifications.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Parameters used to create a notification.

methods.name: sendWatchExtensionReply

deprecated.notes: Use Titanium.WatchSession instead, which is supported on iOS 9 and later.

methods.summary: Marks the end of an openParentApplication:reply execution by a WatchKit extension.
methods.description:
This method must be called after your Titaium application has finished processing the watchkitextensionrequest event. Optional information can be provided in the userInfo argument will be provided back to the WatchKit extension as part of the reply method. If no userInfo is provide nil will be sent to the WatchKit extension to during the reply callback.

This method should be used as part of the watchkitextensionrequest event as shown below.

Ti.App.iOS.addEventListener("watchkitextensionrequest", function(e) {
    var replyContent = {foo: "bar"};
    Ti.App.iOS.sendWatchExtensionReply(e.handlerId,replyContent);
});

parameters.name: handlerId
parameters.summary:
Unique string identifier for the event (`watchkitextensionrequest`)
that initiated from the WatchKit extension calling the openParentApplication:reply method.

parameters.name: userInfo
parameters.summary: Custom data object which will be passed in the reply method to your WatchKit extension.

methods.name: setMinimumBackgroundFetchInterval
methods.summary: Specifies the minimum amount of time that must elapse between background fetch operations. Available only on iOS 7 and later.
methods.description: This property has no effect for apps that do not have the UIBackgroundModes key with the fetch value in its Info.plist file. The default fetch interval for apps is BACKGROUNDFETCHINTERVAL_NEVER. Therefore, you must call this method and set a fetch interval before your app is given background execution time.

parameters.name: fetchInterval
parameters.summary:
The minimum number of seconds that must elapse before another background fetch can be initiated.
This value is advisory only and does not indicate the exact amount of time expected between
fetch operations.

properties.name: continueactivity
properties.summary: Returns a URL to open the app's settings.
properties.description:
Used to create a URL that you can pass to the openURL method. When you open the URL built from this string, the system launches the Settings app and displays the app's custom settings, if it has any.

var settingsURL = Ti.App.iOS.applicationOpenSettingsURL;
if (Ti.Platform.canOpenURL(settingsURL)) {
    Ti.Platform.openURL(settingsURL);
}

properties.name: currentUserNotificationSettings
properties.summary: Notification types and user notification categories the application is registered to use.

properties.name: supportedUserActivityTypes
properties.summary: Provides an Array of the NSUserActivityTypes keys defined within your Titanium project.
properties.description:
Used to obtain a list of the NSUserActivityTypes keys defined in your Titanium project's tiapp.xml file. These NSUserActivityTypes keys are the keys which you can use working with iOS Titanium User Activities. NSUserActivityTypes must be defined at build time in your tiapp.xml file as shown below:

<ios>
  <plist>
  <dict>
    <key>NSUserActivityTypes</key>
      <array>
        <string>com.setdirection.home</string>
        <string>com.setdirection.shelf</string>
        <string>com.setdirection.item</string>
      </array>
    </dict>
    </plist>
  </ios>

constants.name: BACKGROUNDFETCHINTERVAL_MIN
constants.summary: Use with setMinimumBackgroundFetchInterval method. Specifies the smallest fetch interval supported by the system.

constants.name: BACKGROUNDFETCHINTERVAL_NEVER
constants.summary: Use with setMinimumBackgroundFetchInterval method. Used to specify a fetch interval large enough to prevent fetch operations from occurring.

constants.name: EVENT_ACCESSIBILITY_LAYOUT_CHANGED
constants.summary: Convenience constant for system event "accessibilitylayoutchanged".

constants.name: EVENT_ACCESSIBILITY_SCREEN_CHANGED
constants.summary: Convenience constant for system event "accessibilityscreenchanged".

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_ACTIVATION_MODE_BACKGROUND
constants.summary: The action will execute in background. Use with the activationMode property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_ACTIVATION_MODE_FOREGROUND
constants.summary: The action will launch the application and execute in the foreground. Use with the activationMode property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_ALERT_STYLE_ALERT
constants.summary: A alert dialog is presented when the notification is received.
constants.description: Used to check the alertStyle attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_ALERT_STYLE_BANNER
constants.summary: A banner is presented when the notification is received.
constants.description: Used to check the alertStyle attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_ALERT_STYLE_NONE
constants.summary: No banner or alert dialog is presented when the notification is received.
constants.description: Used to check the alertStyle attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED
constants.summary: The application is authorized to post user notifications.
constants.description: Used to check the authorizationStatus attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_DENIED
constants.summary: The application is not authorized to post user notifications.
constants.description: Used to check the authorizationStatus attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_NOT_DETERMINED
constants.summary: The user has not yet made a choice regarding whether the application may post user notifications.
constants.description: Used to check the authorizationStatus attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_PROVISIONAL
constants.summary: The application is provisionally authorized to post non-interruptive user notifications.
constants.description: Used to check the authorizationStatus attribute received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_BEHAVIOR_DEFAULT
constants.summary: Default action behavior with no additional action support.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_BEHAVIOR_TEXTINPUT
constants.summary: Provides a textfield with the notification for the user to enter a text response.
constants.description:
The user input will be passed to the typedText field of the object passed to the callback handling the localnotification event.

Use with the behavior property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_CATEGORY_OPTION_ALLOW_IN_CARPLAY
constants.summary: Allow CarPlay to display notifications of this type.
constants.description: Used in the options attribute when creating a Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_CATEGORY_OPTION_CUSTOM_DISMISS_ACTION
constants.summary: Send dismiss actions to the UNUserNotificationCenter object's delegate for handling.
constants.description: Used in the options attribute when creating a Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_CATEGORY_OPTION_HIDDEN_PREVIEWS_SHOW_SUBTITLE
constants.summary: Show the notification's subtitle, even if the user has disabled notification previews for the app.
constants.description: Used in the options attribute when creating a Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_CATEGORY_OPTION_HIDDEN_PREVIEWS_SHOW_TITLE
constants.summary: Show the notification's title, even if the user has disabled notification previews for the app.
constants.description: Used in the options attribute when creating a Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_CATEGORY_OPTION_NONE
constants.summary: No options.
constants.description: Used in the options attribute when creating a Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_SETTING_DISABLED
constants.summary: The notification setting is turned off.
constants.description: Used to check application-wide enabled notification settings received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_SETTING_ENABLED
constants.summary: The notification setting is turned on.
constants.description: Used to check application-wide enabled notification settings received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_SETTING_NOT_SUPPORTED
constants.summary: The application does not support this notification type.
constants.description: Used to check application-wide enabled notification settings received in requestUserNotificationSettings.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_ALERT
constants.summary: The application may display an alert upon a notification being received. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_BADGE
constants.summary: The application may badge its icon upon a notification being received. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_CRITICAL_ALERT
constants.summary: The ability to play sounds for critical alerts. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_NONE
constants.summary: The application may not present any UI upon a notification being received. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_PROVIDES_APP_NOTIFICATION_SETTINGS
constants.summary: An option indicating the system should display a button for in-app notification settings. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_PROVISIONAL
constants.summary: The ability to post non-interrupting notifications provisionally to the Notification Center. Use with the types property.

constants.name: USER_NOTIFICATION_TYPE_SOUND
constants.summary: The application may play a sound upon a notification being received. Use with the types property.

constants.name: UTTYPE_APPLE_ICNS
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Mac OS icon images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_APPLE_PROTECTED_MPEG4_AUDIO
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for protected MPEG-4 audio (iTunes music store format).

constants.name: UTTYPE_AUDIO
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for all audio content.

constants.name: UTTYPE_BMP
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Windows bitmap images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_FLAT_RTFD
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Rich Text with content embedding, pasteboard format.

constants.name: UTTYPE_GIF
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for GIF images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_HTML
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for HTML.

constants.name: UTTYPE_ICO
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Windows icon images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_IMAGE
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for all image types.

constants.name: UTTYPE_JPEG
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for JPEG images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_JPEG2000
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for JPEG 2000 images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_MOVIE
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for all audiovisual content.

constants.name: UTTYPE_MP3
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for MP3 audio.

constants.name: UTTYPE_MPEG
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 content.

constants.name: UTTYPE_MPEG4
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for MPEG-4 content.

constants.name: UTTYPE_MPEG4_AUDIO
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for MPEG-4 audio.

constants.name: UTTYPE_PDF
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for PDF data.

constants.name: UTTYPE_PICT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for PICT images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_PLAIN_TEXT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for a plain text type, equivalent to MIME type text/plain.

constants.name: UTTYPE_PNG
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for PNG images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_QUICKTIME_IMAGE
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for QuickTime images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_QUICKTIME_MOVIE
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for QuickTime movies.

constants.name: UTTYPE_RTF
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Rich Text.

constants.name: UTTYPE_RTFD
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Rich Text Format Directory, that is, Rich Text with content embedding, on-disk format.

constants.name: UTTYPE_TEXT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for all text types.

constants.name: UTTYPE_TIFF
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for TIFF images.

constants.name: UTTYPE_TXN_TEXT_AND_MULTIMEDIA_DATA
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for MLTE (Textension) format for mixed text and multimedia data.

constants.name: UTTYPE_UTF16_EXTERNAL_PLAIN_TEXT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Unicode-16 with byte-order mark (BOM), or if BOM is not present, an external representation byte order (big-endian).

constants.name: UTTYPE_UTF16_PLAIN_TEXT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Unicode-16, native byte order, with an optional byte-order mark (BOM).

constants.name: UTTYPE_UTF8_PLAIN_TEXT
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for Unicode-8 plain text type.

constants.name: UTTYPE_VIDEO
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for all video content without audio.

constants.name: UTTYPE_WEB_ARCHIVE
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for WebKit webarchive format.

constants.name: UTTYPE_XML
constants.summary: Uniform type identifier for XML.
